main event: An unidentified object was observed by the crew of a C-119 aircraft over Tunis, Libya on February 11, 1953, for approximately 45 minutes.
interesting points: The object was first seen as a red object that appeared aircraft-like and was later described as a sharp bright light with a halo of diffused light around it., The sighting varied in length from 5 to 55 minutes, depending on the observer., Four out of five crew members believed the object was not a star, while one was indecisive., The object was observed at an altitude of 17,000 feet and was noted to have an angular velocity of 1/4 mile per second., The conclusion drawn was that the object was possibly Venus due to its brightness and the conditions at the time.
sighted object: unidentified bright object with a halo of diffused light
